intent_atoms.description: Add support for parsing 'free' and 'skip' boxes as opaque padding segments in the streaming pipeline.
A parser or stub is registered that emits ParseEvent entries for 'free' and 'skip' types without decoding payloads.
Byte range metadata (start offset, size) is preserved so UI/CLI presentations list padding regions accurately.
JSON exports and tree snapshots include nodes with type 'free'/'skip', size, and offsets while omitting payload fields.
Synthetic fixtures are created to cover mixed content scenarios where 'free' boxes interleave with metadata/data boxes.
The parsing pipeline must not attempt to decode the payload of 'free' or 'skip' boxes.
Extend BoxParserRegistry with entries for 'free' and 'skip', reusing existing opaque-box utilities similar to 'mdat'.

functional_units.name: Register free/skip parser
functional_units.description: Add entries to BoxParserRegistry that emit ParseEvent for free and skip boxes without decoding payloads.

functional_units.name: Preserve byte range metadata
functional_units.description: Ensure start offset and size of free/skip boxes are stored in ParseEvent for downstream UI and CLI consumers.

functional_units.name: Generate synthetic padding fixtures
functional_units.description: Create lightweight sample files containing free/skip boxes interleaved with other boxes to test parsing and export.

functional_units.name: CLI JSON output support
functional_units.description: Expose free/skip nodes in CLI JSON exports, including type, size, and offsets but no payload data.

functional_units.name: UI preview integration
functional_units.description: Allow Combine-backed UI stores to display free/skip nodes without additional work.
